page.title: 01INTRODUCTION TO THE AREA
page.content:
This area is mainly farmland and not really used for much else.There are a few villages such as Little Hadham and Albury,but the population is not very large.There are not many places of interest,the main one being St. Mary's church in Albury.This dates from the 13th century.There also used to be a windmill but this was burnt down by its owner due to the cost of its upkeep.
As said previously,most of the land is used for farming and grazing.Also of importance are the hedges which are used by wildlife and these are being destroyed by farmers.
